item.title: RT Kristian Freeman: Ooh, neat -- @obsdmd document loader is in JS @LangChainAI -- loads Markdown and even parses YAML frontmatter ğŸ–¼ï¸ Quick script...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Kristian Freeman
Ooh, neat -- @obsdmd document loader is in JS @LangChainAI -- loads Markdown and even parses YAML frontmatter

ğŸ–¼ï¸ Quick script to load a local vault into Langchain documents. Next is plugging the docs into @Cloudflare Vectorize and querying via an LLM!

https://api.js.langchain.com/classes/langchain_document_loaders_fs_obsidian.ObsidianLoader.html
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Roger Taylor: Leverage @LangChainAI's create_pandas_dataframe_agent() to build an AI assistant for effortless EDA, analysis & data visualization. N...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Roger Taylor
Leverage @LangChainAI's create_pandas_dataframe_agent() to build an AI assistant for effortless EDA, analysis & data visualization.
Nagesh Mashette guides through querying dataframes in NL for efficient hypothesis testing & insights! https://medium.com/@nageshmashette32/automate-data-analysis-with-langchain-3c0d97dec356
#LLMs #NLP #DataViz
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Arsalan Ali: Just explored the entire Gemini API. For now it seems alright. Created a simplified version of the official notebook and used @LangCha...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Arsalan Ali
Just explored the entire Gemini API.
For now it seems alright.

Created a simplified version of the official notebook and used @LangChainAI to mostly interact with the Gemini models.

Notebook:
https://lnkd.in/djeTk-QM

#LLM #GeminiAI #AI #multimodalAI #Google #langchain
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT robot3yes: Just pulled in Mistral support for Agent IX. IX generates component interfaces using JSON schemas. It's quick and easy to integrate new ...
item.description:
RTâ€‚robot3yes
Just pulled in Mistral support for Agent IX.

IX generates component interfaces using JSON schemas. It's quick and easy to integrate new components.

Now I just need API access to test it. ğŸ˜…
https://github.com/kreneskyp/ix/pull/361

item.title: Crew AI is a multi-agent framework built on top of LangChain We're publishing a blog from its creator @joaomdmoura explaining how it works Check it ou...
item.description:
Crew AI is a multi-agent framework built on top of LangChain

We're publishing a blog from its creator @joaomdmoura explaining how it works

Check it out here - and go build some awesome stuff with it!

Blog: https://blog.langchain.dev/crewai-unleashed-future-of-ai-agent-teams/


JoÃ£o Moura:â€‚AI Agents on the cloud plan my next trip! ğŸ¤–â˜ï¸âœˆï¸
I had a lot of fun putting together this post with @Replit and @hwchase17 from @LangChainAI

You can now try this Tricrew of AI Agents yourself (and two other crews) directly on Replit: https://blog.replit.com/crew-ai

RTâ€‚Replit â •
Today we're spotlighting CrewAI, a modular library for orchestrating AI agents, built with @LangChainAI.

Check out the Replit templates and create practical applications, from trip planning to stock analysis: https://replit.com/@crewAI

item.title: RT Astasia Myers: Super interesting report from @LangChainAI on AI @trychroma the most popular vector store 42% of complex queries involve retrieval A...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Astasia Myers
Super interesting report from @LangChainAI on AI

@trychroma the most popular vector store

42% of complex queries involve retrieval

Average 2.3 different types of test feedback, suggesting that developers are having difficulty finding a single metric to rely entirely on

item.title: Re Most used evaluation metrics We see that most people still care primarily about correctness (and not other guardrails like toxicity or prompt injec...
item.description:
Re Most used evaluation metrics

We see that most people still care primarily about correctness (and not other guardrails like toxicity or prompt injection)

https://docs.smith.langchain.com/evaluation/evaluator-implementations
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re How are people testing? Testing LLM Apps is hard. How are people doing it? 1. We see that 83% of test runs have some form of feedback, suggesting t...
item.description:
Re How are people testing?

Testing LLM Apps is hard. How are people doing it?

1. We see that 83% of test runs have some form of feedback, suggesting that most people are finding some metrics to eval (rather than just eyeball)

2. We see an average of 2.3 feedback per run,â€¦ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737884219257593931
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re Top Advanced Retrieval Strategies We primarily see people rolling their own retrieval, speaking to need to customize retrieval for each use case. O...
item.description:
Re Top Advanced Retrieval Strategies

We primarily see people rolling their own retrieval, speaking to need to customize retrieval for each use case. Of general strategies, we see:

1. Self Query https://python.langchain.com/docs/modules/data_connection/retrievers/self_query
2. Hybrid Search
3. Contextual Compressionâ€¦ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1737884217093288306
item.author: LangChain
